description: Number of stable n-celled patterns ("still lifes") in Conway's game of Life.
links: N. D. Elkies, [math/9905194] The still-Life density problem and its generalizations
H. Koenig, Stable Objects (another version of this sequence)
R. C. Schroeppel, A few mathematical experiments
R. Munafo, Still-Lifes with N cells in Conway's game of Life
example: a(4)=2 because the block and the tub are the only 4-cell still lifes.
author: _Robert Munafo_
extensions: More terms from _Stephen A. Silver_, Dec 11 1999
